main event: A bright orange-red ball of fire was observed maneuvering and oscillating horizontally over Cleveland, Ohio on August 20-21, 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as a disc-shaped craft that moved in a circular and elliptical pattern.
The sighting lasted for approximately 3 minutes.
The report includes multiple possible explanations, including balloon, aircraft, astronomical, atmospheric, and insufficient data for evaluation.
There were previous similar sightings reported in the area.
No photographs were included with the report.
